sen.j: 奈良きたまち （なら-）は、奈良県奈良市のならまちより北側の古い市街地を指す地域。
sen.e: Nara Kitamachi is the area which refers to the old urban district on the north of Naramachi in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Nara Kitamachi is the area which refers to the old urban district to the north of Naramachi in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: on the north of → to the north of
sen.e: Nara Kitamachi is the area which refers to the old urban district to the north of Naramachi in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 江戸～昭和期の町並みが残り、「法蓮格子」と呼ばれる様式を用いた町家や、洋風建築の奈良少年刑務所、重要文化財の奈良女子大学記念館などがある。
sen.e: In Nara Kitamachi, an old townscape from Edo to Showa period still remains and you will find a traditional townhouse using the style called "horen-goshi lattice", Western-style architecture Nara juvenile prison, and important cultural property, the Memorial Hall of Nara Women's University.

In Nara Kitamachi, an old townscape from the Edo to Showa periods still remains and you will find a traditional townhouse using the style called 'horen-goshi lattice,' the Nara juvenile prison of Western-style architecture, the Memorial Hall of Nara Women's University which is an important cultural property, and so on.

In Nara Kitamachi, an old townscape from the Edo to Showa periods still remains and you will find a traditional townhouse using the style called 'horen-goshi lattice,' the Nara juvenile prison of Western-style architecture, the Memorial Hall of Nara Women's University which is an important cultural property, and so on.

sen.j: 江戸時代、東大寺などに向かう、奈良の北の玄関口として旅籠や商店が並び、京都へ通じる奈良街道を中心に栄えた地域。
sen.e: In Edo Period, as a north gateway of Nara to Todai-ji Temple, etc., this area flourished centering on Nara-Kaido Road leading to Kyoto and hatago (inn with meals) and shops stood side by side.

In the Edo Period, the Nara Kitamachi area flourished centering on Nara-Kaido Road leading to Kyoto as a north gateway of Nara to Todai-ji Temple, etc., in which hatago (inn with meals) and shops stood side by side.

In the Edo Period, the Nara Kitamachi area flourished centering on Nara-Kaido Road leading to Kyoto as a north gateway of Nara to Todai-ji Temple, etc., in which hatago (inn with meals) and shops stood side by side.

sen.j: 現在は近鉄奈良駅（大宮通り）の北側一帯を指す。
sen.e: Today, this area refers to the whole area of north side of Kintetsu Nara Station (Omiya-dori Street).
Today, the Nara Kitamachi area refers to the overall area of north side of Kintetsu Nara Station (Omiya-dori Street).
Today, the Nara Kitamachi area refers to the overall area of north side of Kintetsu Nara Station (Omiya-dori Street).

sen.j: 近くの一条通りは明治の一時期、大仏鉄道の駅から東大寺へ向かう参道としても栄えた。
sen.e: Nearby Ichijo-dori Street flourished as sando (an approach to the temple) leading to Todai-ji Temple from the station of Daibutsu Railway (Daibutsu Tetsudo) at one time in the Meiji Period.
Nearby Ichijo-dori Street flourished as sando (an approach to the temple) leading to Todai-ji Temple from the station of Daibutsu Railway (Daibutsu Tetsudo) at one time in the Meiji Period.
Nearby Ichijo-dori Street flourished as sando (an approach to the temple) leading to Todai-ji Temple from the station of Daibutsu Railway (Daibutsu Tetsudo) at one time in the Meiji Period.

sen.j: 町を一望した多聞山城は松永久秀が16世紀半ばに築き、近世城郭のモデルとなった四層の天守を備えている。
sen.e: Tamonyama-jo Castle which commands a panoramic view of the town was built by Hisahide MATSUNAGA in the middle of the16th century, and has the four-layered tenshu (main keep or tower of a castle) which became a model for modern castles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tamonyama-jo Castle which commands a panoramic view of the town was built by Hisahide MATSUNAGA in the middle of the16th century, and has the four-layered tenshu (main keep or tower of a castle) which became a model for modern castles.

Tamonyama-jo Castle which commands a panoramic view of the town was built by Hisahide MATSUNAGA in the middle of the16th century, and has the four-layered tenshu (main keep or tower of a castle) which became a model for modern castles.

sen.j: 宣教師ルイス・フロイスがその美しさを称賛。
sen.e: The missionary, Luis FROIS praised its beauty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The missionary, Luis FROIS praised its beauty.
The missionary, Luis FROIS praised its beauty.

sen.j: 安土城の築城にも影響を与えたとされる。
sen.e: It is said that Tamonyama-jo Castle influenced the erection of Azuchi-jo Castle.
It is said that Tamonyama-jo Castle influenced the erection of Azuchi-jo Castle.
It is said that Tamonyama-jo Castle influenced the erection of Azuchi-jo Castle.

sen.j: 1998年（平成10年）8月、「奈良街道町づくり研究会」を設立し「喜び多い街」、「何か懐かしい来たことのある街」、「また来たい街」（きたまち）をキャチフレーズに活動を行う。
sen.e: In August, 1998, "Nara Kaido Machizukuri Kenkyukai (Nara-kaido Road Community-Planning Society)" was established, and its member operate under the catchphrase of "the town with full of joy", "nostalgic town", and "the town that people wish to come again" (Kitamachi).

In August, 1998, 'Nara Kaido Machizukuri Kenkyukai' (Nara-kaido Road Community-Planning Society) was established, and its members have operated under the catchphrase of 'the town full of joy', 'the nostalgic town', and 'the town that people wish to come again' (Kitamachi).

In August, 1998, 'Nara Kaido Machizukuri Kenkyukai' (Nara-kaido Road Community-Planning Society) was established, and its members have operated under the catchphrase of 'the town full of joy', 'the nostalgic town', and 'the town that people wish to come again' (Kitamachi).

sen.j: 2004年（平成16年）、奈良市より「奈良まちかど博物館」の認可を受け、13箇所の施設を一般公開している。
sen.e: In 2004, Nara Kitamachi was approved as "Nara Machikado Museum" from Nara City and thirteen facilities are opened to the public.
In 2004, Nara Kitamachi was approved as 'Nara Machikado Museum' by Nara City, and thirteen facilities are opened to the public.
sen.cmt: from Nara City → by Nara City" " → ' '
sen.e: In 2004, Nara Kitamachi was approved as 'Nara Machikado Museum' by Nara City, and thirteen facilities are opened to the public.

sen.j: 各奈良駅奈良交通バス奈良阪・青山住宅行「今小路」・「手貝町」下車。
